alert.note: Alert for Karnes; Lavaca; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 06 at 9:32AM CDT until April 09 at 9:48AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Fayette, Gonzales, Karnes, Lavaca and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gonzales, Poth, Stockdale, Flatonia, Moulton, Kosciusko, Nixon, Waelder, Smiley, Palmeto State Park, Pandora, Gillett, Cestohowa, Wrightsboro, Cost, Bebe, Monthalia, Oak Forest, Leesville and Hamon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
